= Slot Manager =
Slot Manager is a part of Null Essentials that allows your Server to have reserved Slots, custom Joinmessages and custom Joinsounds.

== Configuration ==
Lets take a look at config.yml from Null Essentials:
{{{
parts:
  #Should Slot Manager be enabled?(Reserved Slots, Joinmessage and -sound)
  slotmanager: true 

#Slot Manager Configuration
slotmanager:
  reserved:
    #How many slots should be reserved? (-1 equals all without the allowplayers limitation)
    count: -1
    #Should we allow normal players to join reserved slots?
    allowplayers: true
  join:
    #Template for customized Joinmessage and -sound:
    #Username:
    #  message: TextToDisplay
    #  sound: UrlToSound
}}}
As you can see, there is a node called slotmanager. This is where all slotmanager(except enabled/disabled state) are set. There are two subgroups right now, reserved and join. Let's take a closer look at them.

=== reserved ===
These are the settings for, who could have guessed, reserved slots. _count_ affects the amount of reserved slots to 'allocate' for this server. Allowed values are -1(all, but ignore allowplayers) and 0-MaxPlayers.
_allowplayers_ affects the behaviour of the onPlayerLogin Event. A value of _true_ will allow client without the ne.slotmanager.reserved permission to join reserved slots, while a value of _false_ will disallow clients to join reserved slots.

=== join ===
This affects the message and sound for specific clients that join. The syntax is like this:
{{{
<Username>:
  [message: 'text']
  [sound: 'url']
}}}
The fields message and sound can be omitted or left empty, in that case the player _Username_ will not have the one that is missing.

== Permissions ==
|| Node || For || Parents ||
|| ne.slotmanager.state || /ne parts <enable|disable> slotmanager || ne.slotmanager.*, ne.* ||
|| ne.slotmanager.reserved || Access to reserved slots || ne.slotmanager.*, ne.* ||
|| ne.slotmanager.sound || Allow user to have a custom join message || ne.slotmanager.`*`, ne.`*` ||
|| ne.slotmanager.message || Allow user to have a custom join sound || ne.slotmanager.`*`, ne.`*` ||
|| ne.slotmanager.set.sound.own || /ne slotmanager set sound `<`url`>` || ne.slotmanager.set.sound.`*`, ne.slotmanager.set.`*`, ne.slotmanager.`*`, ne.`*` ||
|| ne.slotmanager.set.sound.other || /ne slotmanager set sound `<`player`>` `<`url`>` || ne.slotmanager.set.sound.`*`, ne.slotmanager.set.`*`, ne.slotmanager.`*`, ne.`*` ||
